    • Sentiment analysis

Example: Thematic coding

themes.Rmd

The annotate() function with a predefined sentiment task allows you to rate the sentiment of texts using an LLM. The predefined themes() object structures the response by indicating whether specific themes are present in the text, along with proportion scores (0-1) and explanations for each theme.

Loading packages and data 

# We will use the quanteda package for loading a sample corpus of innaugural speeches
# If you have not yet installed the quanteda package, you can do so by:
# install.packages("quanteda")
library(quanteda)
## Package version: 4.3.1
## Unicode version: 15.1
## ICU version: 74.2
## Parallel computing: disabled
## See https://quanteda.io for tutorials and examples.
library(quallmer)
## Loading required package: ellmer
# For educational purposes, we will use a subset of the inaugural speeches corpus
# The three most recent speeches in the corpus
data_corpus_inaugural <- quanteda::data_corpus_inaugural[57:60]

Using annotate() for thematic coding of texts 

# Define themes of interest
topics <- c("Politics", "Economy", "Artificial Intelligence", "Environment", "Healthcare")
# Apply predefined themes task with themes() in the annotate() function
result <- annotate(data_corpus_inaugural, task = themes(topics), 
                   chat_fn = chat_openai, model = "gpt-4o",
                   api_args = list(temperature = 0, seed = 42))
## Running task 'Theme coding' using model: gpt-4o
## [working] (0 + 0) -> 3 -> 1 | ■■■■■■■■■                         25%
## [working] (0 + 0) -> 2 -> 2 | ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■                  50%
## [working] (0 + 0) -> 0 -> 4 | ■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■■  100%
id Politics Economy Artificial Intelligence Environment Healthcare explanation
2013-Obama 0.5 0.20 0 0.15 0.15 The text is a presidential inauguration speech, heavily focused on political themes such as democracy, freedom, and governance, which accounts for 50% of the content. Economic aspects are also discussed, particularly in terms of economic recovery and the importance of a strong middle class, making up 20% of the content. Environmental issues, specifically climate change and sustainable energy, are addressed, contributing 15% to the content. Healthcare is mentioned in the context of Medicare, Medicaid, and Social Security, also contributing 15%. Artificial Intelligence is not mentioned, so it is assigned 0%.
2017-Trump 0.7 0.20 0 0.00 0.10 The text is primarily a political speech, focusing on themes of governance, power transfer, and national unity, which accounts for 70% of the content. Economic issues are also addressed, such as jobs, trade, and infrastructure, making up 20% of the text. Healthcare is briefly mentioned in the context of freeing the Earth from disease, contributing 10%. There is no mention of Artificial Intelligence or specific environmental issues.
2021-Biden 0.7 0.05 0 0.05 0.20 The text is primarily focused on political themes, such as democracy, unity, and the peaceful transfer of power, which accounts for 70% of the content. Healthcare is also a significant topic, mentioned in the context of the pandemic and the need to overcome the virus, making up 20% of the text. The economy is briefly touched upon with references to job losses and rebuilding the middle class, accounting for 5%. The environment is mentioned in the context of a ‘cry for survival from the planet,’ also making up 5%. Artificial Intelligence is not mentioned at all.
2025-Trump 0.6 0.20 0 0.10 0.10 The text is primarily a political speech, focusing on themes of national sovereignty, government reform, and political unity, which accounts for 60% of the content. Economic issues are also significant, with mentions of inflation, energy policy, and trade, making up 20% of the text. Environmental topics are touched upon with references to energy policies and the Green New Deal, accounting for 10%. Healthcare is mentioned in the context of public health system reform and COVID-19 vaccine mandates, also making up 10%. Artificial Intelligence is not mentioned.
